answers.answer: I think they usually put you on bed rest. I don't have preeclampsia, but I have had bad swelling and high blood pressure from being up and moving too much, so I'm on bed rest. I made it to 38 weeks until I had to be on bed rest. I'll be 39 wreks tomorrow. Just keep your feet up when you can, drink water, and sit down as much as possible.

No,  you can't work if you've been diagnosed with preeclampsia.It sounds like what you have is threatened preeclampsia,  and they're keeping an eye on it.   If you do develop preeclampsia,  it's a medical emergency and you will be hospitalized.

I had threatened preeclampsia. My midwife put me on bed rest at 36 or 37 weeks because my job wasn't allowing me to drink much water and I had a lot of stairs leading to my office. If you are at risk, its better to play it safe and tell your doc. You need a bed rest request. If you don't want an emergency c section, you need to take it easy, drink lots of water, and rest with your feet elevated. Good luck and think positive thoughts!

question: Can you work while you have preeclampsia? I'm 33 weeks and my doctor and I are keeping an eye on my swelling and blood pressure, but I was just wondering if anyone has ever had it and continued working or if their doctor put them on bed rest.
